solution_line_template: Jerome bought {cars_last_month} x {multiplier_this_month} = <<{cars_last_month}*{multiplier_this_month}={cars_this_month}>>{cars_this_month} toy cars this month.
So he bought a total of {cars_last_month} + {cars_this_month} = <<{cars_last_month}+{cars_this_month}={total_bought}>>{total_bought} toy cars.
Therefore, Jerome had {total_cars_now} - {total_bought} = <<{total_cars_now}-{total_bought}={original_cars}>>{original_cars} toy cars originally.
